channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why we still need AM radio
item.description: Ariel Aberg-Riger is the author of America Redux: Visual Stories from Our Dynamic History.

item.title: Microsoft just launched powerful AI ‘agents’ that could completely transform your workday — and challenge Google’s workplace dominance
item.description: Microsoft unveils new AI reasoning agents and Copilot features to transform workplace productivity, with Chief Product Officer Aparna Chennapragada sh...

item.title: Tariffs could push up homeowners insurance premiums — and people in these states would see the biggest price hikes
item.description: Tariffs on construction materials could push the average homeowner’s annual insurance premium up to $3,626 by the end of the year, Insurify projects.

item.title: Tesla’s stock is rising, but will Musk’s return revive it for good? It’s not so simple.
item.description: There are various challenges ahead, including tariffs, an evolving EV market and a history of delays on new products.

item.title: $42.1 million poured into startup offering energy-efficient solutions for costly and unwieldy operational data and AI workloads
item.description: The funding infusion sharpens a mission to make hyperscale analytics radically cheaper and greener at the very moment enterprises fear ballooning data...

item.title: Scott Bessent offers a gentler message again, saying ‘America First’ does not mean ‘America alone’
item.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent spoke Wednesday at an Institute of International Finance event in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Trump and Powell are doing a ‘Fed independence’ dance. Keep your portfolio flexible.
item.description: Inflation shocks, the dollar’s decline and political winds are threats to your money now.

item.title: More accurate coding: Researchers adapt Sequential Monte Carlo for AI-generated code
item.description: Researchers from MIT, Yale, McGill University and others found that adapting the Sequential Monte Carlo algorithm can make AI-generated code better.

item.title: SWiRL: The business case for AI that thinks like your best problem-solvers
item.description: Training LLMs on trajectories of reasoning and tool use makes them superior at multi-step reasoning tasks.

item.title: GE Vernova now sees tariff costs of up to $400 million but keeps outlook intact
item.description: GE Vernova’s stock surged Wednesday after the power and renewable-energy company reported quarterly profit that was more than double expectations.
